org.apache.lenya.workflow
Interface Workflow

public interface Workflow

A workflow schema.

A workflow schema defines a state machine (deterministic finite automaton - DFA), consisting of

  • states, including a marked initial state,
  • transitions, and
  • state variables.

    getInitialState

    java.lang.String getInitialState()
    Returns the initial state of this workflow.

    Returns:
    The initial state

    getLeavingTransitions

    Transition[] getLeavingTransitions(java.lang.String state)
                                   throws WorkflowException
    Returns the transitions that leave a state. This method is used, e.g., to disable menu items.

    Parameters:
    state - A state.
    Returns:
    The transitions that leave the state.
    Throws:
    WorkflowException - if the state is not contained.

    getVariableNames

    java.lang.String[] getVariableNames()
    Returns the variable names.

    Returns:
    A string array.

    getName

    java.lang.String getName()
    Returns:
    The name of this workflow.

    getInitialValue

    boolean getInitialValue(java.lang.String variableName)
                        throws WorkflowException
    Parameters:
    variableName - The variable name.
    Returns:
    The initial value of the variable.
    Throws:
    WorkflowException - if the variable does not exist.

    getEvents

    java.lang.String[] getEvents()
    Returns:
    The events.
